New Records: Stephen Curry did not miss a shot from beyond the arc for the first time in his career.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored 30 points and made 10 assists.
Joel Embiid scored 28 points and grabbed 14 rebounds.
Golden State Warriors made 22 out of 39 three-pointers.
Golden State Warriors used a first quarter explosion to beat Philadelphia 76ers 139-105.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sixers must respond on Saturday night when they play the Brooklyn Nets.
Philly is clearly missing Kelly Oubre Jr’s tenacity on both sides of the ball.
The Sixers must win the rebounding battle and limit their turnovers against the Brooklyn Nets.
Getting Paul George going should add another dimension to Philly’s offensive and defensive schemes.
